attributes.action: use modern technology to enable the people of Britain to vote in real time on House of Commons issues
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
When a vote is cast in the house of commons, the people have a representative who casts a vote on thier behalf.

The representative is usually told how to vote by thier party whip and not by the people they represent.

Because technology to support ID cards is possible, why can we not have a system in this country where ANY eligable voter can vote on any issue they care about?

This would lead to a true democracy. As the PM has the desire to "spread democracy around the world", why don't we start with our own country first?
